website_summaries.verdict: Ideal if you're looking for a good quality monitor with a very pronounced curve.
pros: This 27-inch monitor provides great picture quality
Offers HDMI, DisplayPort, and VGA ports
cons: The included speakers don't produce very good sound

customer_reviews.title: Don't understand all of the bad reviews. Mine looks beautiful and worked perfectly right ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't understand all of the bad reviews. Mine looks beautiful and worked perfectly right out of the box. It took a day or two to get use to but thats normal getting use to any new monitor. Very bright, just perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great Gaming Displays for a steal.
customer_reviews.text: June 2, 2017. The monitors arrived well packed and undamaged. Hooked it up and didn't notice any issues at all. I was concerned after reading a few reviews of damaged displays. I bought these to update my older 21.4" displays for surround gaming. The VESA mounting standoffs were included in all 3 monitors thankfully. This is because the monitor stand attachment protrudes out the back and without it, you won't be able to use the VESA mounting points on the back. Will update this review after a few months of use. Liking it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Aldebaran

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor for consoles
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor for consoles. Have both my ps4 and gaming PC hooked up to it and it is amazing. The only couple of flaws I could find were the speakers and the edges of the screen being a little discolored. I have external speakers so the 1st flaw isn't that big of a deal and the discoloration is only noticeable when the background is black.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Benitez

customer_reviews.title: Love the Tight Curvature
customer_reviews.text: This curved monitor is great! I bought it for my wife, but might steal it or buy another. It has a good assortment of inputs, but the main feature is the much tighter curve than some other "curved" monitors that I own. It truly makes viewing any part of the screen as good as any other. The only disadvantage is that it tilts downward, as if it were designed to be set above your head height. We put small books under the front of it to make it level with my wife's face in use. We didn't notice any bad pixels or any faults in the display.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey G. Boldt

customer_reviews.title: I should have spent a little more
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I received a defective monitor, but the colors were washed out. I tried many many different setting combinations to "colors" and "picture" and the quality did not improved. I had my old Asus Monitor side by side and the color difference was so great that it hurt my eyes. Only had it for 8 hours, and now its on its way back to Amazon. I should have spent a little more for a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price. My only complaint is that the pixels ...
customer_reviews.text: Great price. My only complaint is that the pixels bleed, causing funky colors at times. Other 27" monitors costing 2x as much will have better screens, but for someone looking for a larger monitor to help see things better, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: S. B. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE - Inputs go dead - Not able to get to BIOS Screen
customer_reviews.text: Great picture. BUT, if you ever have to load he BIOS screen you are out of luck. The monitor will go into power saving mode on reboot and not activate the inputs for some bizarre reason until an OS boots. I could find NO WAY to keep the input active such that I could boot the PC into the BIOS screen. When I did no for certain (another monitor) I w
customer_reviews.author: Mike S

customer_reviews.title: Too blurry for me to handle
customer_reviews.text: After somehow losing one of these in the mail before the second one arrived. After plugging it in you notice pretty much immediately that brightness of the screen is lacking heavily. Even after an hour of messing with the clunky controls and trying to match it to my 6 year old Dell monitor I could not achieve a good resolution. Everything was washed out and all the text on websites looked blurry and fuzzy around the edges. I changed every setting I could find and cycled through every suggestion online and I was unable to get anything close to usable. I would suggest just paying a little more for a better brand and just skip this all together.
customer_reviews.author: Comic Reader

customer_reviews.title: Washed out
customer_reviews.text: I dont know what I expected at this price but the color on these monitors is off and black is not black. In the picture you can see what im talking about. The monitor on the bottom is a 49" Samsung my desktop is being projected to the other 2 monitors. The black around the picture in the middle is grey..... On the Samsung it is black. I rated them a 1 star because I'm not very impressed with them. I didn't send them back because it wasn't worth the hassel to me. If i had bought them locally I would have returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Ken D

customer_reviews.title: great monitor
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this monitor. You can't even tell it is curved when you are sitting in front of it. I love how large it is. now web pages and games don't look squished!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: These things seem to be incredibly shoddy manufacturing. The first one I received had a bunch of bright white spots on it immediately upon startup. Ok, one defect, no problem and got it returned. The new one had some light bleeding on all sides. Not great, but I can deal with this for the price. Now just under a year later it starts showing black lines and flickering, I hear a high pitched squealing and then it cuts the signal entirely. Bear in mind, I've only even been using this one or two days a week!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must purchase!!!
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical at first considering the price and the fact I had never seen this brand before. Bought 2 of them for a dual display... I am more than impressed by them! These are undoubtedly the best monitors I've ever used. The picture is amazingly clear and bright. Made my wife and kid jealous! Netflix and PRIME videos look incredible and games are sharp. I highly recommend these to EVERYONE !!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul T.

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT!
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is a replacement for one that simply was a major disappointment. Suffice to say that the monitor I returned is a Samsung. This monitor, however, is exactly what I was looking for! The curveature is quite pronounced and definitely adds to the viewing experience. A wide variety of color/user adjustments are available so you can "fine-tune" the display to suit your individual needs. The sleek looking silver brushed stand is made of metal (not plastic) and tilts backwards and forwards. Hook-up was a breeze with a very easy to read manual should you need any questions answered. I am very happy with this purchase and highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: PALMITER

customer_reviews.title: Great For Business
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a gamer and I'm not watching videos on my computer. I mostly write programming code and word process. These monitors are GREAT for that. I've got a dual monitor stand and have them tilted in toward one another for an immersive experience which is great. I like the fact that they have built in speakers, they COME with the spacers necessary to connect them to a VESA monitor stand (due to the curvature), and they have VGA, HDMI & DP ports on the back. So these are great screens (particularly dual) for business. Once you go curved, you'll never go back. I find flat screens to be annoying now that I've been spoiled by curved.
customer_reviews.author: Barron Henley

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for the money
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat this monitor for the price. If you are buying 1080p at this size you either are getting it for someone who just browses and games casually or a kid or something like that. Or you are on a super tight budget. People really into FPS or other gaming at this size and resolution should spring for the 144hz unit but for the MONEY you cannot beat this monitor. No dead pixels, colors are good for this price range, stable on its base (non adjustable) and my kid plays a ton of Minecraft, Fortnite, Roblox and a few others with no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: SDKTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It is an okay budget monitor.
customer_reviews.text: The monitor is decent for the price. It has some pitfalls though. First the backlight bleeds through around the edges. This can give you a gray border around the screen if you like Dark Mode and dark backgrounds. Overall the monitor does give decent video and gameplay. When assembling the monitor, the screw holes are difficult to lineup so it might be easy for someone to strip the screws trying to install the stand. The monitor does its job and looks nice A decent budget monitor if you don't want to spend more money on a IPS screen. It will serve my needs at the moment but I am not sure if I will buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Luke

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price, but breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: This isn't an expensive monitor, and for the price its fairly decent. The screen is lit from the edges rather than the back, which didn't bother me, but it's something to consider. Handle it with care though! I don't know if its the screen itself or the curved design, but this monitor breaks extremely easily. The first one I bought arrived broken, which was no big deal, that happens and they sent me another one. The 2nd one worked well for over 6 months, but broke when I tried to mount it to a boom arm, despite careful handling. So be very careful with this monitor if you choose to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: A cheap curved monitor. Nothing more
customer_reviews.text: While nice as a work monitor I couldn't suggest it for anything more. Pixel density is a bit shoddy leading things to look either blurred or requiring full sharpness which ultimately shows off the low pixel count as words and outlines become jagged. Color depth leaves a lot to be desired as well and it becomes extremely apparent even after very extensive set up. When compared to my television or the monitor this one was supposed to replace, in games there's just no questioning the difference in clarity, richness and depth of color. Get it if you REALLY want a curved monitor, otherwise, save your money and consider a better option.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: I have no idea why anyone likes this monitor
customer_reviews.text: I got this monitor a few months ago and have been regretting my purchase ever since. Using it is like seeing everything through a screen door. It's painfully clear to the naked eye the gap between pixels, and everything just looks awful and unpleasant, even though the colors themselves are fine. The only reason to get this monitor is if you can't afford anything else. Otherwise, spend a little more and get something nice to look at.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Wood

customer_reviews.title: Don't count on VESA mounting
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: After finally getting a hold of Sceptre's customer service, I'm dropping this to one star. I'll never buy another Sceptre again - they are completely unhelpful and are generally uninformed about their own product line. Monitor was okay for the price. The included stand is garbage. My box did not have the spacers that are necessary to VESA mount this. I've contacted the company twice about getting ones sent but they have yet to write me back. I might be able to fix this with a trip to Home Depot. This is kind a big flaw for what is advertised as a gaming monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew C. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, terrible quality - support is awful
customer_reviews.text: When I first purchased this monitor I had to send it right back due to some dead pixels. Now a year later and the monitor is showing a whole bunch of bright white spots all over the screen. I had never heard of this brand before and I probably won't buy another monitor from them again. Edit: Dropped to 1 star because their tech support is awful. They don’t know how to read emails as I constantly had to rewrite the same responses over and over again until they could understand the simplest of requests. Will never buy or recommend this company to even my worst enemies.
customer_reviews.author: GParks14

customer_reviews.title: Nice monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Just received the new monitor, and wow. I am impressed. Not only do they provide an HDMI and a VGA cable, they even provide a screw driver! The power cord is not the old standard, so I needed to run the new line (not a biggie). The stand is cheap, but they do have the screw holes so you can buy your own. (I have never liked the stand that comes with the monitors anyway). The view is crisp, and the curved design is awesome. The perfect replacement of an old monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor
customer_reviews.text: The monitor is very nice, I have messed with the settings on this and I don't think they are as good as they can get because the picture is a little fuzzy still. But nothing I am too concerned about. Like others have said the sound is not the best quality but for gaming or listening to podcasts I really don't care. I do wish the monitor had a headphone jack on it though. Maybe I just need a bluetooth computer. It does come with the adapters for the VERSA mounts which I needed. But beware, once you get them on don't expect to get them back off without some serious elbow grease.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa Curtis

customer_reviews.title: For the price this is ah-mazing
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think it would make a huge difference when I first saw the curvature. It's slight. But if you place it at the right distance from your noggin it actually starts to make sense. You are a bit more aware of what's going on at the edges of the screen, sometimes being the difference between noticing a dude behind a wall trying to snipe you. Gamer talk. I use this with my Xbox and it's well worth it. The sound on it is definitely not something you should ever rely on, but most gamers use headsets. I never bought it for the sound capability.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for--budget mediocrity
customer_reviews.text: I received a monitor with a dead pixel, and was happy to have an ethical reason to return it. This screen can't display text such that it can be clearly read. It has a washed out, dull, low-contrast look. I was surprised, but then realized the price is somewhat reflective of this--it displays things, and it is curved. There you go. What's not fair is shipping a defective monitor. Check yours carefully for dead pixels as soon as received, and exchange. I'll be saving my pennies for something with more clarity, color, and contrast.
customer_reviews.author: Del Tree

customer_reviews.title: Stand issues
customer_reviews.text: This so far is a great monitor with one exception. I gave three stars because of the stand. I installed the stand according to the directions. I bought two of the 27" monitors and both tilt forward on the stands. I have to place something under the front of the stands to get the proper viewing angle. The stands went on according to the directions so I'm not sure if they're the proper stands for this monitor or not. This would be five stars if not for the stand issue.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cooley

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I just wished that I had gotten the 32 inch. It’s easy on your eyes and it really feels immersive. I even gotten one for work because I am on the computer all day. There’s absolutely no strain on my eyes anymore for me.
customer_reviews.author: Maceio

customer_reviews.title: Novelty with Poor Audio
customer_reviews.text: The curved screen is really just a novelty. Doesn't really serve any function. It will not provide an "immersive" experience; it just makes the screen looks funny... The one thing that this item really stands out is its poor audio performance. Feels like someone stick a couple of 99-cent speakers in the monitor. My previous HP monitor had pretty good sound at volume setting of 30. With this unit, at a setting of 95, I feel I can barely hear the sound. The sound quality is also very poor. Like I said, 99-cent speakers.
customer_reviews.author: la3211

customer_reviews.title: Budget Monitors
customer_reviews.text: I bough a couple of these to outfit my home office. They are light and come with VESA mounting brackets allowing me to mount them on an arm. I've had them for about 2 months now and have not seen any dead pixels or other aberrations. However colors do look washed out and faded on these screens, and when you are displaying black you can see back light bleed at all four corners of the screen. I have decided to settle for these since they were cheap, but I would not buy again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Oolon Colluphid

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor works well for the price but the color is not as vivid or clean as I was hoping for. I used this monitor for several months before upgrading to an MSI Optix G27C2 27" 144hz monitor to allow for higher frame rates. I gave this monitor to my younger brother after upgrading and he has been using it with his Xbox One for almost a year and really enjoys it. I would recommend this monitor for console gaming but probable not PC.
customer_reviews.author: Bradon F.

customer_reviews.title: NOT VESA compatible
customer_reviews.text: Update: i forgot to mention. It is absolutely not VESA mount friendly. The metal neck base protrudes out exactly where the VESA mount should be positioned. So you have to take the monitor apart to get the neck base out. HOWEVER, it is much more complicated than a Samsung to take apart to remove the neck base. And this is how I broke my monitor's screen. It's fine if you're not interested in mounting it. They should not say it's VESA compatible because omg it is NOT.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy/ Recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: I built a budget PC and I was looking for a good looking display. After some YouTube reviews I was convinced on this Monitor. I wasn’t expecting much, this this far exceeded my expectations. The picture quality is amazing. I haven’t over clocked the screen yet. I’m really happy with a refresh rate of 75hz. Definitely recommend it. It includes a screw driver to mount the stand. The speakers on the other hand. Don’t expect much, they sound like a phones call when you set it on speaker. 1080p gaming looks good here.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: This is my first curved monitor. I was on the fence about getting one but so far I like it. I'm dropping 1 star due to it having a dead pixel...not worth the hassle of returning it and 1 for having a off set vesa mount. Other manufacturers have the mount in the middle of the screen but Sceptre decided to put it at the bottom. So for me to do a dual setup, I have to buy a 2nd one of these instead of being able to use my non curved 27" (which is about 5" off due to the vesa mount location).
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Hard to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This is a good monitor IF you manually adjust your refresh rate, it says 75 Hz, but it comes out of the box at 60. Once adjusted it's really good. My only complaint is assembly, it almost took an engineer to put the stand on... the screw did not fit, it was a nightmare, I gave up and wall mounted it which was not what I wanted to do. You really can't beat this monitor at this price... it is HUGE.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lalor

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great monitor, out of the box and hooked up in 5 mins; good colors and resolution
customer_reviews.author: Vadim Seltser

customer_reviews.title: Screen quality is horrible, cheaply made product
customer_reviews.text: The picture is a bit blurry, no matter what settings I tweaked, everything looked as if I was seeing something through a bit of a mist. Secondly, the bezel connecting to the monitor itself is flimsy. There is not a way to secure the screen to the base. The first time I bumped my desk with my hip, the monitor fell over and cracked. I had to throw it away. Total waste of $160
customer_reviews.author: Moca

customer_reviews.title: Quality Monitor for Picture and Color
customer_reviews.text: I work at the computer day and night. This is a great monitor. I read other Amazon reviews before buying it, so I knew to set it to 75Hz. It’s not a deal-breaker for me that the power switch is behind the lower front corner. It may not be the most convenient location for the On/Off button but it’s ok for me. I bought a nice thick cutting board (for 20 bucks) as a monitor stand to elevate it a couple of inches, and I am really pleased with my set up.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Levy

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, and amazing customer service
customer_reviews.text: Pros- *75hz is a life changer *curve gives amazing viewing angles *AMAZING customer support, had a bad power supply. talked to support and got a new one sent by express shipping no hastle *perfect size for the 1080p resolution, very sharp and no visible pixels from around 2ft cons- *screen is a little washed out in comparison to more expensive monitors, but nothing to bad *speakers are not very loud and very tinny * screen comes very warm out of the box, but easily changeable in the settings overall- I would rate an 8/10 for the money, just need to keep expectations in mind for the price tag favorite feature- 75 hz screen for gaming is extremely nice
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: Has a great picture and inputs for every computer
customer_reviews.text: Has a great picture and inputs for every computer. My company is upgrading some equipment and I plan on buying more of these when we do it.
customer_reviews.author: Adam W

customer_reviews.title: Quite the monitor for the price.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say...love the curved surface, love the picture quality. I know others have mentioned the speaker quality, but I use headphones or my desktop speaker system w/ subwoofer, so volume is turned down to zero. Otherwise, very easy to assemble and connect to pc. Couldn't be happier w/ the monitor. I've had no issues w/ screen glare or dead pixels. I would certainly consider buying a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Shreck

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2, only 1 remains
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these and they worked good for a little while, but here we are 4 months later and one of them stopped working. Turn it on and it's just a couple colored lines up and down the monitor. They both set next to each other attached to the same monitor stand. Very disappointing, as the Dell LCD it replaced lasted over 10 years and is back out of retirement, still working great. Hopefully the other one doesn't go soon too.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: White leakage everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: The look and feel of the monitor is nice. The screen is in good shape, and overall I thought I got a good deal. Then I turned it on. I have it connected via HDMI from my HP. The colors were a little weak, but I figured I was just used to the 4k from my TV and laptop. So I put an HD movie on. The entire border was leaking white into the picture. It's so distracting that I would only use this for productivity reasons. Needless to say, I am very disappointed. I guess I should have been prepared, but I had my fingers crossed that I'd be lucky.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: so so quality
customer_reviews.text: Bunch of dead pixels that just stay bright white...I can see the clusters of non functioning pixels even when the screen is projecting white. On the other end of the spectrum, blacks are not that deep. Other than that, it meets my needs as on my home PC that is used about 12hrs/wk doing typical chores, playing some modest games and screening the occasional Netflix/Youtube It is a cheap monitor after all, so severe criticism must be reserved for more expensive monitors.
customer_reviews.author: RogerDodger

customer_reviews.title: Great computer monitor. Very happy
customer_reviews.text: I've had this monitor a long time now and I am still very happy. I read reviews before I bought it and saw many complaints of dead pixels so I've been keeping a vigilant eye, however after all this time using the monitor at least 5 hours a day, I can report no such defects. Crystal clear monitor with many options for picture with alright audio but in. The only thing I could complain about is when it is in standby or when it is on with no signal it makes an annoying high pitch humming noise
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I took a gamble buying this after seeing its mixed reviews and I have nothing but good things to say about it. My intention was to use it for playing Rainbow Six Siege because I was using a 55" TV before and it was just too big. Works very well, crisp image, nice curve, easy set up, heavy base. For those who have never used a monitor before don't expect and level of sound quality out of this, you'll need some kind of sound set up to go along with it, but for me that wasn't an issue seeing as I use headphones while playing.
customer_reviews.author: Austin W.

customer_reviews.title: Developed backlight freckles
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 for my desk setup and all 3 had dead/stuck pixels out of the box. Not many, and not in too distracting of places - so I let it go. This is a budget monitor after all. However, after a year, all 3 developed bright speckled areas toward the bottom third. It looks like the backlight or diffusers have freckles. It's horrible. These monitors are useless to me now.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Miguelez

customer_reviews.title: Dead Pixels within a month
customer_reviews.text: For the most part, the monitor is as advertised. I work from home part of the time, and these fit the bill. The color is brilliant, and Ive never had any lag in any video application. That said, I already have two dead pixels on one of the screens, and Ive had these for one month. I noticed it literally one day beyond the return window. According to Sceptre's limited warranty, clusters of up to 5 dead non-contiguous, or 3 contiguous pixels is acceptable. I would tend to disagree. Previously, I had a couple of cheaper monitors that I had for nearly 3 years. There was not a single dead pixel on them when I replaced them. Somewhat disappointed overall.
customer_reviews.author: Dwaine Woosley

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT value, GREAT picture, no BLB, glow, or splotchiness
customer_reviews.text: Used in a tight fitting corner as a security camera monitor. Its very bright when set up, the curve and coating deflects glare, mounted to a VESA arm with included offsets. Sharp and crisp with great color. Again, used for security camera feed. I have an Acer X34P, the 34" 3440x1440p Ultrawide 120hz Gsync for my PC, and i can honestly say i would not be embarassed to have this display next to it, as a 2nd monitor even if its only 75hz and 27" 1080p so a bit smaller. My X34P has some BLB in bottom corners, due to IPS panel. Not sure what panel type this Sceptre has, but its nice and even.
customer_reviews.author: Zissou

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I needed to adjust the settings as it was way too hazy because the brightness and backlight was way too high. Now the black looks more true, rather than charcoal gray. The monitors come with spacers so they can be mounted. The mounting arms come with screws, but if you’re replacing old monitors from your arms and don’t have the right screws it could be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Osiris

customer_reviews.title: Nice but a bit hazy
customer_reviews.text: Love the monitor, the built quality and all but does have a kinda haze and the blacks are not deep. Though it is a deal for the price. Overall it is a good monitor. UPDATE 27/5/19: saw a buyer's recommendation to fix the hazy thing; just check the refresh rate, set it to 75Hz and all is beautiful now. So happy with this monitor:)
customer_reviews.author: nash

customer_reviews.title: A new way to game.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is absolutely perfect - perfect for my budget, perfect for gaming, perfect in every way. There isn't really anything negative I can say about it. It came earlier than expected, the pieces were all there, it was easy to assemble and set up. I particularly love the way the screen can be adjusted, and how games allow you to adjust the software to fit the screen. It's just perfect. I would definitely purchase one of these again, one for every room.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Howard

customer_reviews.title: I consider this computer screen the Bentley of the computer screens that I've had.
customer_reviews.text: Best computer screen I've ever owned. The slight curve to the screen definently helps add to the amazing clarity, graphics,and the amazing HD colors. You can totally adjust every aspect of this screen, you can totally break down every option_as in, zoom, colors, high def, high contrast etc. I highly recommend this product to anyone that wants to step up the quality of your computer's capabilities!!! You can't go wrong buying this product!
customer_reviews.author: Nostraskeetous

customer_reviews.title: Monitor died after less than 30 days but fixed at no cost
customer_reviews.text: Update: Screen died after 30 days of minimal usage. The manufacture provided a label to ship back at their cost. Minimal hassle-I just dropped it off at Fed Ex. They fixed it and had it back to me in one week working fine. Display quality, sharpness - works for home office intermitent use, but not very clear or sharp. I love the curved screen. However, the unadjustable base tilts down, making it uncomfortable to view. I have to adjust the height of my desk up so it is much higher than me and is still uncomfortable. It would be nice for someone with a short torso, or if it was hung to a wall.
customer_reviews.author: CA Sun

customer_reviews.title: Color distortion on dark screens
customer_reviews.text: The edges when the screen are on has a faded ring of color, the speakers with the volume all the way up are still very low. It does work and the center part of the screen has good picture quality on brighter colors. Dark colors is distorted
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING monitor its absolutely gorgeus view and build quality is really sturdy and they include a free hdmi cable and vesa mount screws these guys are top quality i would 100% buy again the speakers arent great but just the fact that a MONITOR comes with built in speakers is just above and beyond what i could have asked for and at such a great price you cant afford not to get one ive recommended this to all friends who come by and visit it. i think once my motorcycle is paid off ill have to pick up another one its too good to pass up on
customer_reviews.author: Kale Cartwright

customer_reviews.title: Great product, easily could be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product, incredible picture. I was so impressed with the first I had to purchase a second. However the second did not come with the same hardware as the first that is required to mount on a monitor mount (the base attachment for this monitor ar ticks out preventing proper attachment without some long spacer screws). Additionally the second monitor came in with a single dead pixel in the bottom right corner (very annoying when playing dark games or movies as it is a constant bright white dot). Packaged very well, good company and quick shopper. I can't give 5 start just due to the pixel and the missing hardware, however if I could I'd give it a 4.5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Geis

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a larger monitor for when I'm doing web design or writing a book. This is the perfect size as I can view pages side-by-side. It's very light-weight as well; but sturdy. I also like the oval stand that is ring-like and very stable. It does tilt, which is important for taller people. The curvature is good and helps with glare from lights. Overall, I would buy another, assuming it lasts! Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Diane H Holycross

customer_reviews.title: Washed out picture without adjustments...The 1st one was damaged and the box/styro form wasn't, so it went in broken....BAD
customer_reviews.text: Their TV's are not good either ...new to the mfg market. You can't adjust what you want, there are about 6 presets...Econo, movie, etc... It looks washed out ...you can see anything that's white on the screen...nor adjust the contrast.. I can't hardly see what I'm typing.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Curved screen low price.
customer_reviews.text: Nice monitor very low price and nice big screen for the money. Nice colors after calibration, Is it a reference monitors probably not, is it capable of a nice image for gaming, moving watching and internet and light computer use absolutely. I just wish the cabinet was high gloss black to give the screen just a wee bit more pop and contrast but for the price zero complaints.
customer_reviews.author: James Michael Denig

customer_reviews.title: numorous dead pixels
customer_reviews.text: This isn't a horrible monitor for the price. I have had it for a few months now and it has been used quite a bit since the kids play games. I rarely get on the computer but I did for the first time in a wile and noticed all of the dead pixels scattered which was kind of a bummer. If I had to buy again I would probably think twice about it and check other options at the price but wouldn't rule it out.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Bracket
customer_reviews.text: Had to give a bad review as this is my 2nd monitor from them; be very careful. I found out that all the monitors have different backings, the screws that came with it; did not fit: the mounting bracket in back, could not be removed say if you wanted to mount it to a arm or a different mount, you can’t as the mount in back of the monitor is sticking out like by 2”. Like I said my 1st work and looked great and the bracket in back could be removed this one; you can’t remove it
customer_reviews.author: Tall man

customer_reviews.title: great product, I would recommend
customer_reviews.text: really like the product, bought for a larger screen to use alongside Surface book (I also bought an adapter). Works great, comes with HDMI and another cord that hooks up to my old lap top too. Haven't used the sound so I can't speak to that but for the price I'm more than happy with the product I received. Might buy another one too some day
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor, great price
customer_reviews.text: For $160, most people know that your buying a midrange monitor. I feel like I almost cheated the manufacturer if im being honest. This monitor is HUGE its got an amazing curve and is suprisingly crisp for a 1080p monitor. the only complaint i have is that the colors are a bit washed out, which can be mostly corrected by changing up the settings. I put my gamma up to 2.4 And changing the default to warm in the pre-set color settings menu 8/10, amazing monitor for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Good monitor, screws sucked
customer_reviews.text: Got my monitor today, the picture is great (you need to change it from 60hz to 75hz though, or it looks like hot garbage). The sound is not very good on the speakers, but I mean for 150 bucks, who cares. The picture is great, the refresh rate is great, everything looks amazing on it. Well worth the money. Just wish the neck screws fit in the neck, am half worried the things gonna fall off as the screws went in crooked and are only half in there.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew C. Chilton

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful monitor at a very competitive price
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful monitor for a very competitive price ($159 USD as I write this). Easy to assemble (the stand comes in two pieces) and comes with stand-offs if you want to use a VESA mount (provides a flat surface to mount to). I ran a couple of online monitor tests and the display is flawless. I am very happy with my purchase and can recommend this monitor highly.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Warbington

customer_reviews.title: Kinda cheap
customer_reviews.text: The monitor is okay for the money but it is nothing to write home about the sound quality is terrible so bad that I actually did not know that the volume was all the way up I could barely hear it some YouTubers and other people have made statements that there is a light bleeding around the corners when in a dark screen unfortunately this is true but it also happens and bright environments in your name and it is kind of noticeable the picture is also a little hazy not as crisp as I was wanting all in all it's decent if you can't afford better
customer_reviews.author: Amy pease

customer_reviews.title: it works great looks good and even comes with the wires
customer_reviews.text: I really can't figure out while this item was so affordable, it works great looks good and even comes with the wires. I mounted mine to a wall and use it as a TV because I rarely watch anything other than YouTube, amazon and netflix.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Ray K

customer_reviews.title: Best monitor I've ever had!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing. I used to be a brand snob for one other major TV/Monitor Maker. My fiancé has a Sceptre and other's recommended it as well and for the price I decided to give it a shot. Absolutely amazing. Bright Vibrant color. Have to give them credit too as they added risers for using a wall mount as without them there's a metal post for the desk stand that would prevent using it in that configuration. Love it
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Sceptre has great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this monitor for a little over 2 months, and I also have the 32” from Sceptre for a little over 5 months. Both have been amazing. Picture quality is great, no problems with my games. I bought a mount for both of them, and had lost the spacers. Contacted the company, support helped me figure out what I needed, and they’re sending me the spacers so the mount will work free of charge.
customer_reviews.author: MHendrix

customer_reviews.title: Good Monitor, just one problem.
customer_reviews.text: As a real person who has purchased this item, I loved it, for eight months that is. On September 27, 2018, this monitor has burnt on me, in the middle of a Competitive CS:GO game. I purchased this item on January 27, 2018 (coincidence I know). Now don't take this review in a bad way, this is an AMAZING monitor. It has good picture and it's pretty durable. It has speakers, just not the best in the world. This'll complete my review as I don't know what else to say, just know it's a good monitor, take it from a Gold Nova III.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for good price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend as a second monitor for him (he has another brand of curved monitor) it seamlessly fit in with the other monitor! Picture is clear. The monitor was exactly what I was looking for, and my boyfriend is very happy with it! Great price for a great monitor. I would buy it again
customer_reviews.author: ZippyZ

customer_reviews.title: Worked well, but very fragile
customer_reviews.text: I have used this monitor for about a year at work. It held up and worked well until moving it to my home office for work during corona virus outbreak. Was very gentle with it during the car ride home, but it cracked and developed a large black stripe down the center of the screen, I am assuming from its own weight due to the curved nature of the screen... If you buy definitely keep the box for any transport.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: I find this is my favorite screen and it isn't an issue going back and ...
customer_reviews.text: This screen performs exactly as I need. I was a little concerned about a curved screen as I use multiple screens for my office and none of the others are curved. I find this is my favorite screen and it isn't an issue going back and forth between the curved and flat.
customer_reviews.author: GSTampa

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Inexpensive. Acceptable inputs for price. (HDMI, VGA, DP) Cons: Tons of back light bleed. Horrible color reproduction. Regardless of what I do, it constantly looks washed out. The power cable on these are horrible. Instead of using a brick mid-cable or having most of the power handled in the monitor, it uses an oversized plug end that takes up so much room that nothing can be plugged in beside it. Power cable too short. It's seriously only 3ft. I had to plug it into an extension just to reach the outlet under my desk.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Really not a good product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these. One was perfectly fine no issue, the other was a brick. HDMI port not working and vga was extremely off centered. Returned the defective item and a replacement was sent. Same issue with the replacement. A 2nd replacement made and still having the same issue. 1 item ok out of four is not really a good ratio. I like the curve but had to return all of them because of this experience. Idea was great too bad most of them from my experience looks like junk and refurbish. Dont buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Shernan Moselina

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good little monitor
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good little monitor. Put it with a package for my son for christmas as a desktop set up. He enjoys it and it has a pretty good picture.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Well... about dead pixels...
customer_reviews.text: 3.25 months later, perhaps about 12 dead pixels on the display. Nothing major, just 'annoyances'. Like seeing a 'smudge' on the monitor you want to wipe away. Or some extra periods here and there. Love the monitor for gaming, because my character is always moving around. Reading or typing text on a white background however, you keep wanting to delete your 'mistyped periods'.
customer_reviews.author: Jim W

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly out of the box
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this monitor really is a good buy. I purchased the screen and it came double boxed. The packaging was great, nothing was damaged or dented. I purchased an Insignia brand Mini Display port to HDMI from Best Buy and it connected with ZERO problems. Some things to note: I'm using an MacBook Pro Early 2011 - The screen DOES tilt some. I would say between 10 and 20 degrees. - There ARE speakers; hooked up via HDMI I was able to listen to youtube with no problem. It's tinny sounding, but there are speakers. - There were no dead pixels or backlight problems.
customer_reviews.author: Tierra Maria

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had just spent a little more and gotten a better quality monitor. I have an HP monitor I use in a protrait setting that kills this monitor in every way but size so that’s not a great sign. I didn’t return it because im lazy and it’s not the absolute worst. Save your monies, kiddies, and get a more expensive monitor. Update 1.5 years later: Monitor no longer works. Don't buy!
customer_reviews.author: Cole A. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Great screens! I have two of them mounted on ...
customer_reviews.text: Great screens! I have two of them mounted on a stand in my office. they are great!!! You will have a slightly different look on them if you don't have 2 HDMI inputs to plug these into. I have them going into a docking station and the one on the HDMI port is much brighter. the standard VGA connection is a lot darker. I have tried to adjust to no avail. Still very solid screens.
customer_reviews.author: Native Texan

customer_reviews.title: Nice Monitor for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Got this to add to a new computer system. Running Windows 10 on it. I like that you can changed the video output depending on what I'm doing with it. A lot brighter when I set it to the "User" Preset & switch it to the "Movie" Preset set for movies and videos (which tones it down for them. I'm not a gamer, but it has presets for those to. The mounting screws for the stand were not drilled precisely straight but they still were able to lock in enough to hold tight. Overall, I'm glad that I got this, definitely better than the one I replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty darn good !
customer_reviews.text: Really good size, couldn’t function without it now. Good picture Audio sucks! But I have it hooked up through my HDMI so I have to use the monitor speakers unless I plug speakers from it which I don’t want more on my desk or something else I have to plug into power strip, Only downside.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: The screen is good for the money but dont expect to use the monitors speakers
customer_reviews.text: The only issue I have with this monitor is that the included speakers sound too bad to be of use for anything in the realm of entertainment (gaming, watching movies/tv, etc.). Personally I think it would've been better off to drop the price a bit and not include built-in speakers just due to the quality of the sound. Luckily I was planning on using other speakers anyway, but someone getting this monitor because it had built-in speakers over another monitor will likely be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Washed Out Color
customer_reviews.text: Got this fast and for a good price however if you are looking for vivid color and sharpness this is not the monitor for you, pay a little more and get something a little more optimal. This monitor is fine a secondary screen but not for colorful gaming or photo work, it's very washed out.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Bad Speakers
customer_reviews.text: This is a great monitor for the price but the built in speakers are a joke. They sound like blown out headphones turned all the way up. Also, left and right edges have a little bit of light bleeding through. That being said, I still think this is completely worth the price. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: DWMP

customer_reviews.title: A very dismal monitor
customer_reviews.text: Monitor was very dim and text was very blurry. Adjusting settings on the monitor, connecting to all 3 available video ports, and attaching to different computers didn't make any difference. Ended up getting a headache after 20 minutes of use. Very disappointed in this purchase and filed for a return right away. Won't even waste my time with trying a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Endymionls

customer_reviews.title: It was good until it wasn't
customer_reviews.text: I bought this monitor for school and it worked fine for 6 months the there was some burn in on the bottom of my screen. I knew I couldn't return it so I went through the Sceptre to get it repaired. Took a month to get back only to have dead pixels on my screen. My advice buy something else and don't buy this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Thora Alcendor

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great product... Took a gamble on this company since I never used them before.... Overall great experience in the last month or two using this thing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Deconti

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: There is a black spot at the bottom of the screen. I'm guessing it's bad pixels. It's not too bad, but defiantly noticeable. I have nothing to compare it to, but if you're looking for a nice screen at a decent price, I'd say you can't go wrong. I'd assume if you're looking for something high end, go elsewhere. There are some imperfections.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really love this monitor
customer_reviews.text: What a difference from what I was using! I really love this monitor, I'm a gamer and it looks great. A tip for you: After you boot up your PC with this monitor connected for the first time, do a restart, I had to restart before I had the full 1920-1020 option.
customer_reviews.author: Nate87654

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only a year
customer_reviews.text: This monitor was great. I loved it, but it only lasted a year. Even considering the poor standards of electronics (generally speaking), I expect a monitor that costs well over 100 dollars to last more than 1 year.
customer_reviews.author: rammstein23

customer_reviews.title: Beware of this manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: The first 8 months it was only. But now (still in the 12 months warranty the screen does not work on the right 1/5th. The manufacturer refused to accept an exchange or repair. Just looking at the pics they state that I physically damaged the screen. That is absolutely WRONG. Beware of this manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Manfred Steinbichler

customer_reviews.title: I love these monitors
customer_reviews.text: Damn son! I love these monitors! Im not going to lie, these are pretty excessive for what I do for now. Im not a gamer, and I am just starting my path to coding, but I do use both monitors for personal use, as well as for work. I have both plugged in to each box, so it pays to have the different connections. And the screens are amazeballls! no hate here.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Best monitor for casual gamers
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend it, the monitor will work in 75Hz in some games, its not a monitor problem, its the game architecture that doesn't let the monitor to work in 75 Hz. An example Rainbow six siege runs at 75Hz , but BTF1 runs at 60Hz
customer_reviews.author: abdullah

customer_reviews.title: Looks like it will be nice
customer_reviews.text: Cant really review this item due to the fact is was broke upon plugging it in. Seems this is a common occurence. I saw this in reviews but thought what are the chances. I asked for a return 3am on 26th and should have replacement by 9pm today. Will update review accordingly. Update: LOVE IT. I almost wish I would of gotten a bigger one but the colors and curve are awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor but watch out for the stand
customer_reviews.text: This is a great monitor, i used this for gaming and was very impressed with the picture quality and i loved the curved screen which. While everything was good beware the mount that comes with it. The monitor itseld is very heavy and the stand is not stable enough to hold it. I recommend doing a wall mount if possible or getting a better stand.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jamaal Williams

customer_reviews.title: Junk Monitors - Flickered from Day 1... return on Day 2
customer_reviews.text: It's all in the title. Used several pairs of cables and none helped. Both monitors flickered in the same fashion. Other monitors connected to the same PC worked fine. Returned immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Romano

customer_reviews.title: DOA out of box
customer_reviews.text: Dead out of the box, no power, no splash screen or led. At least one screw for the stand was poorly machined and nearly impossible to tighten. Customer support said to return it. After reading other comments it appears very hit and miss for this product. I requested a return and I will buy something different
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: stopped working after 7 months
customer_reviews.text: One day suddenly the display was all garbled and flashing. Could get it to work briefly by switching to VGA port instead of HDMI, but that didn't work long, either. Paid for return shipping to have it serviced under warranty, and they sent it back and it was still broken. Now they aren't answering their phone.
customer_reviews.author: Karsluma

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Quality
customer_reviews.text: I waited 6 months before posting a review. And good news this monitor has NOT been a disappointment. I am never going back to a non-curved monitor again. The depth of what you see and how closer you feel to what you are viewing is great! A+ Sceptre. My screenshot doesn't do it justice it looks so much crisper in person
customer_reviews.author: G.Hendrix
